required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Dual-plane Ultrasound Imaging During Vascular Access Procedures
clinical_study.official_title: Dual-plane Ultrasound Imaging During Vascular Access Procedures

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are evaluating the clinical efficiency of utilization of a dual-plane simultaneous view ultrasound probe (Butterfly iQ+; Butterfly Network, Inc.) during arterial catheter placement in the operating room

primary_outcome.measure: First-stick success rate of ultrasound-guided peripheral arterial catheter placement
primary_outcome.description: Number of first-stick success rate of ultrasound-guided peripheral arterial catheter placement

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of attempts for successful cannulation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of attempts to achieved successful arterial catheter cannulation; attempt will be defined as a single insertion of the needle into the skin.

secondary_outcome.measure: Amount of time required for successful arterial catheter cannulation
secondary_outcome.description: Amount of time measured in minutes for successful arterial catheter cannulation

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of failed attempts for cannulation
secondary_outcome.description: Number of failed attempts leading to unsuccessful arterial catheter cannulation

arm_group.description: Arterial line placement via standard mechanism; utilization of a single-plane ultrasound probe
Arterial line placement utilizing dual-plane, Butterfly iQ+ ultrasound probe

intervention.description: Diagnostic ultrasound probe on-market (FDA approved) capable of dual-plane viewing

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria
- Patient: Elective surgical patients requiring non-emergent ultrasound-guided radial arterial catheter placement
- Providers: Anesthesia providers to include trainees, certified registered nurse anesthetists (CRNA) and attending anesthesia providers.
Exclusion Criteria
- Patient
- Pregnant
- Patients in a moribund state or palliative care only
- Vulnerable patients (i.e. Severe mental handicap, non-decisional)
- History of peripheral arterial disease
- Placement of arterial catheter without ultrasound guidance
- Provider: Medical students or CRNA students.
